humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, the left breast, which underwent a modified radical mastectomy, had 14 nodes that were negative for carcinoma (0/14). The right breast, which underwent a simple mastectomy, had two sentinel nodes that were also negative for carcinoma (0/2). Therefore, based on the rules provided, the N stage for this patient is N0, as there are no positive lymph nodes.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for staging cancer is based on the number of lymph nodes involved. In this report, the left breast had 14 nodes negative for carcinoma (0/14), and the right breast had no sentinel lymph nodes positive for carcinoma (0/2). Therefore, the patient's N stage is N0, as there is no evidence of lymph node involvement.
